cont.entity_a: Reduces if there are walls between the laptop and router.
cont.entity_b: N connection causes constant dropped signals and requires repeated resets. Weaker than expected; requires DD-WRT firmware for better performance.

cont.entity_a: Issues with shared mode and DNS passthrough.
cont.entity_b: Setup utility initially struggled to find the router. Easy setup and configuration using a wired connection.

cont.entity_a: Works with cable internet connection. Does not work with DSL modems.
cont.entity_b: Works well with older Linksys products, but newer ones have high failure rates. Product worked great for wired, wireless, and Voice over IP.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight with a carry case, good for traveling and securing connections.
Gets hot, ensure it is not covered.

cont.entity_b: Product looks well-made, but Draft-N technology is too new. Dim LED lights and inconvenient reset button placement.

cont.entity_a: Router stopped working after warranty expired.
cont.entity_b: Router has frequent wireless disconnects and requires manual intervention. Not as reliable as older models.

cont.entity_a: Installation can be challenging without IT knowledge.
cont.entity_b: Poor install software but works well after adjusting settings.
Router works well with multiple devices but requires periodic power recycling.
Good range in a two-level house. The router is powerful and has good range with G mode. Router has a good range and speed but lacks a Gigabit connection.
Good for security but requires running a Linksys program to add computers to the network.
